bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 108 (Thursday, June 11, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. FUDGE:H.R. 7165.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 17The Congress shall have Power *** To exercise exclusiveLegislation in all Cases whatsoever, over such District (notexceeding ten Miles square) as may, by cession of particularStates, and the Acceptance of Congress, become the Seat ofthe Government of the United States, and to exercise likeAuthority over all Places purchased by the Consent of theLegislature of the State in which the Same shall be, for theErection of Forts, Magazines, Arsenals, dock-Yards, and otherneedful Buildings.[Page H2390]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

District of Columbia Government Title Equality Act

This bill redesignates (1) the Office of the Mayor of the District of Columbia as the Office of the Governor of the District, (2) the Council of the District as the Legislative Assembly of the District, and (3) the Office of the Chair of the Council of the District as the Office of the Speaker of the Legislative Assembly of the District.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.title: District of Columbia Government Title Equality Act
District of Columbia Government Title Equality Act

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: District of Columbia Government Title Equality Act

To amend the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to redesignate the Office of the Mayor of the District of Columbia as the Office of the Governor of the District of Columbia and to redesignate the Council of the District of Columbia as the Legislative Assembly of the District of Columbia, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
